title: Introduction to WordPress
note: This section explains the fundamental concepts of WordPress. It covers what WordPress is, its history, and the key differences between the self-hosted version (WordPress.org) and the commercial service (WordPress.com). The concept of a Content Management System (CMS) is introduced using WordPress as the primary example.

title: Local Development Setup
note: Learn how to install WordPress on a local computer for development and testing. This lesson provides step-by-step instructions for setting up a local server environment using software like XAMPP, WAMP, or MAMP, including creating a local database and running the WordPress installation.

title: Navigating the WordPress Dashboard
note: This section provides a detailed tour of the WordPress admin dashboard. It explains the purpose of each menu item, including the Dashboard home, Posts, Media, Pages, Comments, Appearance, Plugins, Users, Tools, and Settings, providing a foundational understanding of where to find key features.

title: Creating Content: Posts and Pages
note: Understand the distinction between Posts and Pages in WordPress. This lesson details how to create, edit, and publish both content types using the Gutenberg block editor. It covers adding text, headings, lists, and other fundamental content blocks, and explains the use of categories and tags for organizing posts.

title: Managing Media
note: This lesson focuses on the WordPress Media Library. It covers how to upload, view, edit, and delete media files such as images, videos, and documents. The section also explains image details like alt text, captions, and descriptions for SEO and accessibility purposes.

title: Introduction to Themes
note: Learn how WordPress themes control the visual design of a website. This section covers how to search for, install, and activate themes from the official WordPress repository. It also introduces the Theme Customizer for making live visual changes like updating the site title, colors, and header image.

title: Understanding WordPress Plugins
note: This lesson explains the role of plugins in extending WordPress functionality. It demonstrates how to find, install, and manage plugins from the WordPress plugin directory. The concept of modular functionality is explained, with examples of essential plugin types like SEO, security, and contact forms.

title: Managing Users and Roles
note: This section covers user management in WordPress. It details the different user roles (Administrator, Editor, Author, Contributor, Subscriber), their respective permissions, and how to add, edit, and delete users from the dashboard. This is crucial for multi-author or membership sites.

title: Configuring Core Settings
note: Explore the main WordPress settings panels. This lesson explains how to configure the General (site title, timezone), Writing (default category), Reading (homepage display), Discussion (comments), and Permalink (URL structure) settings to optimize a new website.

title: Working with Widgets and Menus
note: This section teaches how to manage website navigation and content blocks in sidebars or footers. It covers creating and arranging custom navigation menus using the Menu Editor. It also explains how to add, remove, and configure widgets in designated widget areas provided by the theme.

title: Basic WordPress SEO
note: An introduction to Search Engine Optimization (SEO) within the WordPress context. This lesson explains how to use a popular SEO plugin (like Yoast SEO or All in One SEO) to set focus keywords, edit meta titles and descriptions, and analyze content for better search engine visibility.

title: Essential Security Practices
note: This lesson covers fundamental security measures for any WordPress site. Topics include the importance of using strong passwords, keeping WordPress core, themes, and plugins updated, and installing a reputable security plugin to monitor for threats and harden the installation.

title: Website Maintenance and Backups
note: Understand the importance of regular maintenance. This section explains how to perform updates for WordPress core, themes, and plugins safely. It also covers the critical process of setting up automated website backups using a plugin to prevent data loss.

title: Advanced: Introduction to Child Themes
note: This lesson introduces the concept of child themes. It explains what a child theme is, why it is the best practice for making custom CSS or function modifications, and how to create a basic child theme for an existing parent theme to ensure custom changes are not lost during updates.

title: Advanced: Introduction to E-commerce with WooCommerce
note: This section provides an overview of turning a WordPress site into an online store using the WooCommerce plugin. It covers the initial setup, how to add a simple product, configure payment gateways, and manage orders, providing a foundational understanding of WordPress e-commerce.
